page.title: 04CLUBS CHELWOOD GATE
page.content: {ASHDOWN WOMEN'S INSTITUTE,}with 50_60 members, is only eleven years old and an evening institute, so it attracts working women and mothers with young children. It holds monthly meetings at the Village Hall, an annual Summer Supper and Christmas Party & a bian_ nual Produce Show. It also arranges occasional theatre outings.{THE SAVE {THE CHILDREN FUND}branch at Chelwood Gate is mainly concerned with fund raising. Its Soup Lunches & Coffee Mornings with "Bring & Buy" have be- come a regular feature. In 1984 it raised Â£2.737 against Â£106 in its 1st year, 1970.{MOTHERS & TODDLERS}group meets weekly during term time in the Village Hall, to enable mothers of young children to meet others in the same situation.
